results.title: Birds of the tide
results.brief_description: Tidal flats, exposed at low tide on Westernport bay, support vegetation which harbours small marine life. They provide in turn, the feeding grounds for a large variety of birds. Inland from these grounds lies Rhyll Swamp, a protected area which is an important breeding ground for such species of bird as the Royal Spoonbill and White hen. The film looks at the influence of tides on wading and fishing birds and shows them in their nesting colonies in Rhyll Swamp. Filmed by Art Mayer and Graham Pizzey. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Birds of the Sun God. In Flight Movie
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wildlife on One”.
Two films narrated by David Attenborough from the BBC Wildlife on one series. “Birds of the Sun God” tells the fascinating story of the partnership between hummingbirds and plants, a partnership which has lasted three million years. “In Flight Movie” uses remarkable new filming techniques to enable us to take to the air ourselves. This unique film enables you to fly in the clouds with a flock of geese, look over the shoulder of a soaring buzzard or hedge hop with a speeding starling, revealing just how a bird’s design is shaped to the life it leads - in flight! Issued as a BBC wildlife special.

results.title: Birds of the seashore
results.brief_description: A close-up view of the water birds of Canada’s east coast - their habits, breeding grounds, peculiarities and distinguishing marks. Included are herring gulls, gannets, eider ducks, great blue herons, black guillemots, razor-billed auks and cormorants. Throughout the film many bird calls are heard.

results.title: Birds of the prairie marshes
results.brief_description: This film studies several species of wild ducks, geese and other waterfowl - some reared in permanent captivity, others transient seasonal visitors to the Delta Waterfowl Research Station on one of the largest marsh areas on the shore of Lake Manitoba. From the constant parade of wild fowl swimming about on the Station’s ponds, for the camera singles out individual birds for close observation while the commentary discusses their behaviour, nesting and migratory habits, and range in North America. No other credits available.

results.title: Birds of prey
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Studies the development and habitats of American owls, vultures, eagles, hawks and includes scenes of hunting, nesting and feeding of the young. No other credits available.

results.title: Birds of our storybooks
results.brief_description: Birds which children encounter in their stories and texts are observed in their natural habitats and as they appear in book illustrations. Birds included are the robin, cardinal, crow, owl, sparrow, wren, woodpecker, jay and seagull. Their characteristics - colouring, song and habits are integrated with poems and stories at the primary level.

results.title: Birds of Canada. No. 6
results.brief_description: The pileated woodpecker, the yellow-bellied sapsucker and the common loon are objects of study in this film. The distinguishing features of the woodpecker and sapsucker are pointed out, while the loon, a water bird, comes in for special mention.

results.title: Birds of a feather (K)
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow Productions, Nick Bosustow and Terri Loewy
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon which focuses on the concept of nonconformity by telling a story about a bored, dejected bird, which, attracted by the beautiful plumes of a passerby’s hat, seizes the feathers, and proudly assumes a new appearance.

results.title: Birds for All Seasons
results.brief_description: There are more than 10,000 kinds of birds and without their song, brilliant colours and flamboyant displays the world would be an impoverished place. This video, specially adapted from the major BBC television series, takes a unique look at the planet’s bird life, emphasising their responses to the changing seasons. Birds have intriguing ways of coping with the earth’s varied climates. Courtship, mating, fledging, feeding and flight, all unfold the beauty and diversity of feathered lifestyles in this superb celebration of birds worldwide. Rated: G

results.title: Birds and their characteristics
results.brief_description: Shows in detail the characteristics which differentiate birds from the other groups of vertebrates-feathers, wings and legs, warm-bloodedness and beaks. Demonstrates the adaptations and special characteristics of several kinds of birds, and shows details of a bird’s flight using slow-motion photography. No other credits available.
